nodes.bodyText: I think 0.0.0.0 here should be replaced with DockerClientFactory.instance().dockerHostIpAddress(), if that's the endpoint the client will be trying to reach at

On your machine - yes :)
See "There is no place <...>" here:
https://bsideup.github.io/posts/testcontainers_fixed_ports/

I don't use fixed port but the address the client connects to is made using something like
container.getContainerIpAddress() + ":" + container.getMappedPort(ETCD_CLIENT_PORT)

Then, by changing the address as you suggested, the client fails to connect because of:
connection refused: localhost/127.0.0.1:32804

Which seems to be expected as etcd inside the container won't bind to all addresses but on loopback

Interesting!
I assumed the bind address is controlled with -listen-client-urls and not -advertise-client-urls. Or did you change both?
Also from here:
https://etcd.io/docs/v3.3.12/faq/

advertise-client-urls and initial-advertise-peer-urls specify the addresses etcd clients or other etcd members should use to contact the etcd server. The advertise addresses must be reachable from the remote machines. Do not advertise addresses like localhost or 0.0.0.0 for a production setup since these addresses are unreachable from remote machines.
mh, in fact it is another issue with a test, let me fix it
@bsideup ok fixed now, thx for the suggestion
Consider also checking Windows and npipe

nodes.bodyText:
actually, I just realized that ETCD_CLIENT_PORT will not be the same as the randomly selected port.
Since it works, perhaps you don't need it at all?
seems to fail top start if that option is not set

just out of curiosity - can you try using a non-default port?
I have a guess that it reconnects to localhost where you already have etcd running on the default port.
When I look at the doc it looks like advertise-client-urls and listen-client-urls are both bound to the same port
this is because they use static ports. It reminds me of Kafka, he had to fight with the same issue there, this is why we have a bit fancy implementation of KafkaContainer :D
